ygData.subject: Re: Twisting question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... skill is probably less than 33%.  I ll start keeping track and see if I can come up with an actual % rate instead of an estimate. I dont reall know about
ygData.messageBody:
:My success rate for twisting songs with a 95 DEX and 45 singing/instrument
skill is probably less than 33%. I'll start keeping track and see if I can
come up with an actual % rate instead of an estimate.

I dont reall know about this, but with my level 8 bard, I can nearly always twist my Chant of Battle, Whistling Warsong, and Selo's fairly successfuly. I would say that my success rate is about 80%-90%.

When I get the message "You missed a note", I do keep pushing the song
button but usually I just keep getting the same message. Only when the
first song runs out do I get to start another one.

This doesnt seem to happen to me all that often, usually if I keep pressing the song button, it works on the 2nd or 3rd try.

Galtin
Illian, Wood Elven Bard, Fennin Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Roop Dirump [SMTP:roop@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 2:59 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Twisting question
>
> From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
>
> Twisting songs: playing for instance Whistling Warsong and Anthem de Arms
> so
> that both shields are on the screen at once. Singing one, getting the
> shield up, then stop singing and starting another, then going back to the
> first song to keep that shield up. Some call playing three like this
> juggling.
>
> I have always managed to pull it off, even at lower levels. When you miss
> a
> note, just immediately double click the icon you need again, should only
> take a split second between each attempt until you get the graphical
> pyrotechnics. Doesn't seem that I miss notes that often, though, ever. I
> heard charisma had more effect on songs than dexterity. Dexterity, to me,
> seems like it would have an effect on more physical things like how often
> one can get in blows with a weapon.
>
> Hm, how often is it your missing notes anyway? Perhaps should test this
> with lv 1 bard with low charisma/dexterity high charisma/dexterity. The
> manual says that bards need intelligence, but I don't believe this.
>
> Roop
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andy <skimaster@...>
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Date: Monday, May 03, 1999 7:12 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Twisting question
>
>
> >what is twisting songs?
> >
> >
> >Illian
